result.execSummary:
The defendant Nekola S Lowe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any sentence currently being served.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must remain absolutely sober. 
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
Must not possess or consume controlled substances unless he has a valid prescription for a physician or health care provider, or drug paraphernalia.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.

timeConds.notes: Court grants 30 days sentence credit. Court grants work release and Huber privileges for work, work search, treatment or domestic Huber.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility. 
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Concurrent with: 13CF106

judgments.dispoDesc: Probation is revoked and sentence is imposed.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Jail regarding Defendant's programming.

Defendant Nekola S Lowe in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Defendant Nekola S Lowe in custody.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 16CF93 & 15CF175

16CF93 - Defendant pleads guilty to count 1. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty. Count 2 is dismissed and read-in. Parties waive PSI. Court accepts the waiver. 
Victim rights have been complied with. Argument by State. Argument by Defense. Defendant addresses the court. 

Prison - 
1 year 6 months initial confinement. 
2 years extended supervision 
Defendant is eligible to Substance Abuse and Challenge Incarceration programs. 
Consecutive to 15CF175 & 13CF106
Costs. 

15CF175 - Sentencing hearing on revocation. No additions/corrections to the revocation summary. 

Court relates and orders: Prison - 
1 year 6 months initial confinement - Sentence credit 317 days. 
2 years extended supervision 
Defendant is eligible to Substance Abuse and Challenge Incarceration programs. 
Concurrent to 13CF106. 

Felony admonitions given. WEDS form given. JAIL FAXED. 
Order for DNA form given - to be taken immediatly.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 25, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
of jury trial cancellation for trial that was scheduled for 8/27/2015

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nekola S Lowe in court with attorney Kari Suzanne Hoel.  Defendant Nekola S Lowe in custody.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF175 and 15CT69 called.  State recites agreement.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.

15CF175
Count 1 - Guilty plea
Count 2 - DRI

15CT69 DRI

The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  Stipulation to waive PSI - Court approves waiver of PSI.  State relates.  Attorney Hoel relates.  Defendant relates.  Court relates and orders:

SW - 2 years Probation - Concurrent with any sentence currently serving
6 months jail - Credit for 30 days - Work release/Huber privileges granted for work, work search, treatment or domestic huber
Must remain absolutely sober
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages
Must not possess or consume controlled substances, unless he has a valid prescription from a physician or health care provider, or drug paraphernalia
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent
Court costs, assessments and surcharges

Order for DNA Specimen given to defendant.  Voting rights and firearm warning given.

Defendant Nekola S Lowe in court with attorney Kari Suzanne Hoel.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CT69 and 15CF175 called.  15CF175 Backup JT 8/27/15 - Proposed Jury Instructions, Verdict Forms and any Motions are to be filed no later than 8/21/15 - Both cases set for 
  Plea hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Application for Return of Bond (Denied at 5/11/15 Hearing)

Defendant Nekola S Lowe in court with attorney Kari Suzanne Hoel by telephone.  Defendant Nekola S Lowe in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:36 Case called and Court relates.  State relates.  Attorney Hoel relates.  Court relates and denies request to return the bond previously posted.

Defendant Nekola S Lowe in court with attorney Kari Suzanne Hoel.  Defendant Nekola S Lowe in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts Defendant's waiver, finds probable cause and binds over for trial. State makes correction to probable cause portion of Complaint. Should be Agent Meister from Dept of Corrections, not Agent Simpkins. State files Information. Defendant waives formal reading and pleads NG. Defense makes bond modification request. State makes objection. Court denies bond modification request.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.
